attributes.action: Make retesting of all road users compulsory every 5 years to ensure road safety.
attributes.background: With road deaths increased in 2014 by 4% from 2013 to 1775, serious road injuries increasing by 5% in 2014 from 2013 to 22807 and the total of 194,477 casualties of all severities in reported road traffic accidents during 2014 retesting of road users is essential to protecting the roads.
attributes.additional_details: http://tinyurl.com/nkzmbzh shows the evidence. What is proposed is that road users be charged for the retest. If they pass the test they are refunded the entire test fee as they are competent, if they fail they revert to a provisional licence and have to retrain similar to learners. This makes roads safer (priority), increases employment within the DVSA (better for workforce), provides additional income source which can be put on improving the road network in the UK. Winners all round.

attributes.action: Debate funding for social care and the inequalities it poses to the NHS budget
attributes.background: Iris Sibley is not alone. Yes this is an extreme case and is not the norm, but the notion of being stuck in a hospital bed (at a cost of £90,000-the equivalent to 90 weeks in a home) because social care cannot respond is not excuse for failing our older generation. We need a national discussion.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/feb/06/woman-89-trapped-hospital-six-months-despite-fit-leave-iris-sibley

attributes.action: STOP THE BAN ON MENTHOL CIGARETTES
attributes.background:
Menthol cigarettes are about to become illegal.

Under new tobacco laws, menthol flavour in cigarettes will be phased out over the next four years – ready for a complete ban on May 20, 2020.
attributes.additional_details: As a smoker trying to cut down I've found menthol cigarettes to be a stepping stone to cut down to around 5 cigarettes a day from around 30. With the withdrawal of menthol cigarettes people will turn to illegal ways to get hold of them. Crime and costs for the government will rocket. Also people won't have an effective way to stop so problems will get worse. Also cigarettes will be no longer sold in packs of ten so this will encourage harsher smoking and will cost more on the NHS. STOP THE BAN

attributes.action: UK should allocate more of its aid and development money to endangered species
attributes.background:
A proviso should be added to the aid and development money that we provide to Africa, that some of the money must to go towards endangered species.
Hopefully if the UK put aside more funds for endangered species, the African governments will also make a change.

attributes.action: Ban the advertising of Alcohol on UK TV.
attributes.background:
The UK Government are living in the dark ages, they have put a clear ban on all Tobacco products, banning smoking in public places and at work, Banning all TV adverts for Tobacco products.

Alcohol should be banned, there are more kids Drinking in 2017 than there are Smoking.

Alcohol is worse.
attributes.additional_details:
Go to you local street corner and look at the kids and what they are doing PM's.

Most of them are getting pissed only 2 out of 5 will be smoking.

Get a grip on real life and wake up.

attributes.action: Build A Road Link From Great Britain To Northern Ireland
attributes.background:
I'd like to see a road link be built with either a bridge or tunnel from the mainland (Great Britain), to Northern Ireland.
Not only would this connect the whole of the UK, but I belive would benefit trade between the home nations.
All of a sudden, Northern Ireland would be much more accessible.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-23672538

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=/amp/www.scotsman.com/business/companies/could-a-bridge-or-tunnel-one-day-link-scotland-with-ireland-1-4130353/amp&ved=0ahUKEwiQpvja_fTRAhUrBcAKHUxXA0UQFggpMAE&usg=AFQjCNFu7YCXfYxhQLc5wcsOrzUFPaKjRA&sig2=_FE223uc_ZiJK6gyYXPuMA

http://www.railforums.co.uk/showthread.php?t=35376

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Irish_Sea_fixed_crossing

attributes.action: Greater punishment for drivers convicted of drug or alcohol offences
attributes.background: Laws already allow for higher alcohol consumption in the UK than in many other countries and yet we allow offenders to face very limited actions or penalties for what is a serious offence. Repeat offenders see no consequence for their actions regardless of if they injure or kill anyone.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014 for example between 220 and 260 people were killed in Great Britain where at least 1 driver was over the drink drive limit
The total number of casualties of all types in drink drive accidents is 8,210. 
2015 show there were between 200 and 290 deaths in drink drive accidents AN INCREASE ON THE PREVIOUS YEAR

attributes.action: Make labelling GMO foods mandatory.
attributes.background: It is still unsure as to the health effects of Genetically Modified Organism's and there is evidence to support the unsustainablility of GMO's in future agriculture.

attributes.action: Remove the NHS from party politics
attributes.background: Remove the NHS from party politics. Consider an option similar to an independent non-political NHS committee that will be responsible for the budget and running of the NHS. Often the NHS is a political football and used to gain seats in elections. It needs to be run independently outside of politics
attributes.additional_details: When it comes to the day-to-day running of the NHS, the role of national politics should be significantly reduced.

attributes.action: MPs must have a vote on our proposed deal before reaching the EU parliament.
attributes.background: We must give our MPs the right to scrutinise the deal we're offering BEFORE the European parliament. We must show unity as a nation when going about Brexit talks and show the entire EU that any deal we proposed is back by Westminster.

attributes.action: Revoke requiring military personnel to swear Oath to the Monarchy & God.
attributes.background:
I considered joining the Navy Reserves until I discovered you are required to swear and Oath of Alliegence to the Monarch and God. 
I feel this shouldn't be in place as it can prevent people from wanting to join. An oath to the Monarchy and religious beliefs should not interfere with service.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oath_of_Allegiance_(United_Kingdom)#Armed_forces

attributes.action: Make Holocaust denial illegal in the UK
attributes.background: In a number of European countries Holocaust denial is an illegal practice including Germany, Austria, Belgium and France. To deny the Holocaust is to deny the suffering of millions and minimise the gross wrongs done against Jewish, disabled, homosexual and non-white people in the 1930s/40s.
attributes.additional_details: In Germany the law states: "(3) Whosoever publicly or in a meeting approves of, denies or downplays an act committed under the rule of National Socialism of the kind indicated in section 6 (1) of the Code of International Criminal Law, in a manner capable of disturbing the public peace shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding five years or a fine." This is the type of ruling I believe should be put in place in the UK.

attributes.action: Integrate reCAPTCHA so signatures are legitimate rather than bot scripted.
attributes.background: If media agencies are going to quote the numbers of signatories as being indicative of public support then this website needs to do more to ensure that bots can't sign it. Using Google's free reCAPTCHA service would be a simple way of stripping out the vast majority of bots.

attributes.action: Lower university fees down to £3,000 as they were before 2012.
attributes.background: People want to access further education but don't have the necessary funds to support themselves. By lowering the fees students will not leave university with crippling debts.

attributes.action: Prevent a second referendum on Leaving the EU, as the majority voted leave.
attributes.background: The majority voted to leave the EU, we ask that this democratic vote be upheld & respected. We furthermore request we leave the EU single market, so we may embrace the rest of the world as a Global Britain. With opportunity to create trade deals with the rest of the world we will grow as a nation.
attributes.additional_details: Many are trying to prevent the formal leave of the U.K. From the EU, which is a direct attack on our democratic vote. Such people include Tony Blair, Richard Branson & Caroline Lucas. This was not a racist, ignorant vote to leave. It was to embrace the rest of the world, right to self rule & control of our own borders.

attributes.action: Prevent Xi Jinping from making any State Visits to the United Kingdom
attributes.background: Xi Jinping should not be allowed to enter the UK in his capacity as head of the Chinese government due to the Chinese communist parties prolific violation of human rights.
attributes.additional_details: Since Xi Jinping became President of the People's Republic of China (PRC) in March 2013, the human rights group CHRD has documented more than 1,800 cases of arbitrary detention and torture of human rights activists and lawyers.

attributes.action: Share all the steps of Brexit with the public on a weekly basis.
attributes.background: This petition is not asking for change to a particular matter, rather simply requesting that all decisions, new deals, or any other steps taken on in the negotiations during the procedure of Brexit, be shared with the public before they finalized.
attributes.additional_details:
Nothing in history comes remotely close to the change that will happen when Brexit actually happens in full force.

And 90% of us will be affected in one way or another. 

Therefore we ask the government to give the people who voted for this, and who voted the people in government, knowledge of every deal, decision or law as they are taken on, step by step.

attributes.action: Capital gains tax should be levied on the sale of second homes.
attributes.background: The housing crisis is being exacerbated by the out of control practice of residential property being traded as a capital gains tax free investment. Every aspect of UK society would benefit by a capital gains tax being levied on the sale of all second homes.

attributes.action: Reinstate Functional Skills as an alternative for Level 3 EYE's
attributes.background: I am concerned that in 2014, the government altered the requirements for those taking Level 3 in EYE and now, all Level 3 EYE's must have at least a C grade in GCSE English and maths to count in the ratios - with equitable alternatives such as Functional Skills no longer considered as an option.
attributes.additional_details: Potential new recruits, who have all the skills, including good English and maths, to be excellent Early Years Educators, will be barred from the sector. Its only a matter of time before we do not have the practitioners to fill the much needed roles which will have catastrophic impact on the Early Years sector, and in turn on parents and children. 30 hours free Child care is on its way.

attributes.action: Stop outstanding council tax debt being passed onto Debt collection agencies.
attributes.background:
Stop outstanding council tax debt being passed onto Debt collection agencies and Bailffs.
If anyone in the UK has or is experiencing any kind of financial difficulties then passing the debt to any Debt collection agency or Bailffs incur extra cost to which adds extra stress and anxiety.

attributes.action: Debate possibility that the "Peoples Will" has changed since Scotland Referendum
attributes.background:
In 2014 the Scottish public voted to Remain a part of the UK and it is increasingly evident that the full implications were not considered regarding Remain in the run-up to the referendum. 

Numerous polls suggest there would now be a clear majority to Leave.
attributes.additional_details: Any such debate should be before any Brexit implications debate as this referendum was in 2014 and the EU Leave/Remain vote was in 2016.

attributes.action: Abolish VAT and instead increase corporation tax
attributes.background:
VAT stunts growth of SME's

Raising tax based on profits would encourage enterprise and encourage and help businesses of all sizes to grow.

attributes.action: Call for an international sporting boycott of the USA due to its discrimination
attributes.background: The US ban on muslim entry ignores several elements of The Geneva convention on Human rights:  "freedom of thought, conscience and religion" , "equality before the law" and "presumption of innocence until proven guilty". The ban will be used as "evidence" to incite and recruit potential terrorists.
attributes.additional_details: Dividing communities and creating an illusion of a war with Islam will provide "evidence" for those trying to recruit followers to terrorist groups. The ban could cause even those whose inclination is against violence to reconsider. It also introduces a dangerous direction of movement for the country which likes to be considered the leader of the free world. The sporting boycott showed South Africa how strongly the world disapproved of apartheid. A sporting Boycott of America would do the same.

attributes.action: Points removed by DVLA should be erased by insurance companies at the same time.
attributes.background: Insurance companies hold on to points which have been removed by the DVLA for an extra year and are pumping up the price of insurance or refusing insurance altogether. I believe this is legalised theft and totally unfair.
attributes.additional_details: On 21st December 2012, I got caught without insurance by a technicality: I believed that I was insured but had missed a payment,  unknown to me Ellephant Insurance cancelled it without telling me. My payday was the next day and I had plans to pay then anyway so I would have found out. As a result I got an in 10.  6 points which stay on the licence for 4 years pumping up car insurance by lots and lots of money. (I STILL BELIEVE IT WAS NOT MY FAULT).  So 4 years have passed and still my car insurance is sky high as all the insurance companies keep it on record and used it against us for an extra year. THIS IS WRONG! THIS MUST CHANGE NOW!

attributes.action: Recall the UK ambassador to the USA in protest against the travel ban
attributes.background: On 27 January 2017, the U.S. President signed an executive order banning all entry of people from seven muslim-majority countries. This includes refugees, holders of visas and green cards, and current. U.S. residents. The UK should officially recall its ambassador to the US in protest.
attributes.additional_details: The executive order signed by U.S. President Donald Trump and its consequences have been widely covered in the press. Many people currently travelling but living in the USA are suddenly separated from their loved ones, including refugees. The order is officially motivated by "anti-terrorism" but does not make anybody safer anywhere, no national from any listed country has commited terrorism on US soil. The UK must send the clearest possible signal of disapproval by recalling the US ambassador.

attributes.action: Mersey Tunnel Bill to be repealed so that its provisions no longer apply.
attributes.background: The provision of the Bill has a negative effect on the economy of the North West of England.

attributes.action: Ban the use of sat navs designed for cars by lorries
attributes.background: Lorries using sat navs designed for cars have caused numerous accidents by driving down roads not intended for use by lorries

attributes.action: Make DVSA to allow cameras during the driving exams.
attributes.background:
There are too many wrongful decisions and incompetent driving examiners out there, but DVSA does not allow any recording, inside or outside of the vehicle during examinations.
Lets allow filming of exams, to put pressure on examiners to judge exams fairly, and to keep record for despute if needed.

attributes.action: Bring back EMA money allowance for college students.
attributes.background: College students in need of money in order to support themselves instead of living off the bare minimum.

attributes.action: The Government should set up an independent body to monitor MPs Social Media
attributes.background: Social media usage by MPs is on the increase and given their influence over potential voters it is important that the posts that MPs write, share and endorse are clear and honest and not misleading or false in anyway. The Government  should set up an independent body to monitor these accounts.
attributes.additional_details: Some voters accept as genuine, without question, posts on social media that are either written, endorsed or shared by MPs. The government should set up an independent body to monitor and police MPs Social Media accounts. Were it can be proven an MP has intentionally lied or spread false information on Social Media, this body should have regulatory powers to impose sanctions and or fines on the MPs responsible. It is important that MPs are seen to be as transparent as possible.

attributes.action: Referendum for England & Wales to leave the UK if we don't leave the EU & Laws
attributes.background: It was clear in the referendum that the free movement of Labour was one of the main reasons people voted to leave the EU. We do not want to be bound by the EU or any of its laws and this includes the single market and especially free movement of people. IF Scotland can push for this then so can I/we
attributes.additional_details: Refer to the refruredum leave campaign about controlling immigration, via using a different system and taking back control of our laws.

attributes.action: Stop Cuts To Mental Health
attributes.background: Mental Health is a illness which can not be taken away it will always be part of the person it effects, it's not like breaking a leg and it will health this is something that will never heal.  Theresa May talks about a country that works for everyone why not mentally ill people
attributes.additional_details: If cuts are made to Mental Health then place where people can go to talk about this may have to close then there would be nothing left for them. Just the opportunity to talk to someone it can make a big difference, but if this was taken away who would they talk to some people have no family and are all alone. People take their own lives or self harm because there is no help for them. How would you feel if someone you cared about did this!?

attributes.action: Pair schools here with school in developing world to send over technology.
attributes.background: In order to help implement resources to help out children in the developing world we think that by donating technology we can make a difference to their lives. For example, a computer could help give children an insight in different opportunities available

attributes.action: Carers leave for those in full time employment to care for an immediate relative
attributes.background: Having seen the NHS crisis it is clear that most of the problem is "bed blocking" patients who's treatment is complete but cannot go home as there is no home care in place. Instead of waiting for Social care to be sorted. It would be preferable for a relative to be allowed paid leave.
attributes.additional_details: This could become a right in the same way as maternity leave. Used for short term care to relieve strains on social care as has recently been disclosed on News media.

attributes.action: Reverse the past 5 years of cuts to Social Care Budgets
attributes.background: The NHS is grinding to a halt often due to the lack of social care for patients awaiting discharge from hospital, and from the lack of community care obliging the elderly to attend A&E when they would be better helped at home.  The UK's Social care budget has been cut by 31% over the past 5 years.
attributes.additional_details: Financial Statistics from the UK Directors of Adult Social Services budget survey 2015

attributes.action: Have an honest open debate about the NHS, social care, future funding & needs.
attributes.background: All political parties disguise the truth facing the people of Britain; the NHS and social care is woefully underfunded and perhaps badly or structurally managed. In any event it does not meet our current or future needs and this is not just a problem for now it is a problem for many years to come.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many links where supporting "evidence" can be found and doubtless the government will point to contrary "evidence." But that misses the spirit of this petition - forget the politics let the people decide decide what we need and then how best to fund it. Nothing should be ruled out or in.

https://www.kingsfund.org.uk/projects/nhs-in-a-nutshell/health-care-spending-compared

https://fullfact.org/health/uk-health-spending-compared-france-and-germany/

attributes.action: Stop funding Free Childcare for parents who do not work
attributes.background: The Government currently fund free childcare places for children over 2 years old, if the parents fall within a set 'eligibility criteria'. This includes Job Seekers Allowance. Surely parents who are unemployed can look after their own children. Maybe Job Centre can issue vouchers for interviews etc

attributes.action: Make London into a free WiFi city.
attributes.background: The government should implement free WiFi in London. This would give access to people who ordinarily would not be able to afford it. It would also encourage businesses and citizens to move to London. It has been tested in many cities around the world with great success.

attributes.action:
Make July 1st Diana Princess of Wales Day
.....a National Bank Holiday....
attributes.background: 20 years ago we lost this amazing woman and what better tribute to her than making her birthday, July 1st, a national bank holiday to celebrate her life and the joy she brought to millions in this country and around the world......

attributes.action: Enforce pet ownership licence for each animal owned and microchipping
attributes.background: There are too many animals being dumped, abandoned and stolen in the UK.  It is deeply upsetting to see horses dumped because they have been neglected, family dogs stolen for baiting in dog fights and the resulting injured dogs.  This can be controlled by enforcing animal owners to obtain a licence.
attributes.additional_details:
There is endless evidence from all the animal rescue charities. RSPCA and World Horse Welfare to name a couple.  The number of unwanted animals is increasing each year. Some control must be taken
I suggest a large fines for non licences or bin chipped animals and pets.  Any unlicensed or Unchipped should be removed into care for resale or rehoming. The fines will cover the cost of sending out enforcing officers and administrative costs.

attributes.action: Stop outsourcing assessments for PIP and make fit for Mental Health sufferers.
attributes.background: The current assessment trivialises common issues like depression and anxiety and does not take these into consideration when deciding these claims. The form and the assessor only consider physical ailments and not how mental ability often prevent physical ability and is tantamount to discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: ATOS Healthcare also often misrepresent an individuals needs and conversations they have had during PIP assessments and this has been well documented in the press and many websites previously. Here are a couple of examples: http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/new-claims-of-atos-assessment-lies-are-tip-of-a-massive-iceberg/ and http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/atos-nurse-lied-about-pip-claimant-attending-assessment-alone/

attributes.action: Allow NHS staff of 15+ years to retire early. At the age of 55.
attributes.background: Allow NHS staff who have worked for the service for 15+ years to retire early with a full pension at the age of 55. This is for their dedication to to the service and time that they have missed with family members over the years whilst caring for others family members.

attributes.action: Stop risking our lives and health. Set up a royal commission to reform the NHS.
attributes.background: I am a retired medical doctor and have seen standards in health care deteriorate over several decades. My own experience and that of family and friends have reinforced that view. It is time to do something positive.
attributes.additional_details: Letter to The Sunday Times November 20, 2016 by over 60 consultants calling for a royal commission to cure the NHS. Leading article in the same issue by Sarah-Kate Templeton: 'We must think the unpalatable to stop death of NHS say doctors'. Owen Paterson's report in October 2016 comparing the UK's NHS with other systems in the West. It found that 46,000 people died unnecessarily each year because of failings in our health service.

attributes.action: Introduce 2 part practical driving test, with the inclusion of a motorway test.
attributes.background:
Motorists lack of knowledge of the Highway Code is creating a culture of dangerous driving, which is likely to be the cause of many accidents.

I would like to see the current driving test revised to introduce a new 
2nd part that tests a motorists practical competence of motorway driving.
attributes.additional_details:
A learner driver is prohibited from using a motorway, and their first use of a motorway will only be after they have passed their driving test. Drivers need to be tested on their practical competence and application of the rules before being allowed on motorways alone. 

On a daily basis I witness motorist's breaching rules 264, 267 & 268 of the Highway Code which cover lane discipline and overtaking. DoT report of road traffic accidents shows an increase of people killed or seriously injured.

attributes.action: Introduce "tax free allowance" after working 37.5 hours or more per week
attributes.background: Every year, thousands of hard working people work 50/60 hour weeks to supplement their pay and are taxed to high heaven. If someone works hard, should they have their reward taken from them? People should not be taxed for working extra.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to do under the speed limit (when there's no traffic)
attributes.background: It's illegal to do over the speed limit because you could crash and/or kill someone BUT people doing under the speed limit can be just as bad.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been lots of times when people have been doing the speed limit and had to brake hard because a learner or unconfident driver is doing half or under half the speed limit.

AND times when people do the national speed limit on country roads and they come around a corner to find someone doing 20mph. It's not safe.

It also causes traffic and delays on the roads

attributes.action: The Government immediately brings the Crime and Courts Act 2013 s.40 into force.
attributes.background: Parliament enacted s.40(6) “This section does not apply until such time as a body is first recognised as an approved regulator”. IMPRESS is an approved regulator. Secretaries of State say, ‘The time is not yet right’. Further consultation defies the will of Parliament: an abuse of government power.
attributes.additional_details:
If a TV/radio programme treats you unfairly and/or unwarrantably infringes your privacy, you have a right to complain to the independent Ofcom.  The Press should also be accountable without costs risk to the complainant: but they continue to complain and lobby!
See: IMPRESS http://tinyurl.com/zcy5q36
HackedOff: http://tinyurl.com/jag72kt for positive views and rebuttal of Press claims and the merits of IPSO.
Voices of victims  HackedOff: http://tinyurl.com/j7wuvgk and http://tinyurl.com/zxhvrr3

attributes.action: Ban disturbing photo's on new tobacco packaging
attributes.background:
Ban disturbing photos on new tobacco packaging

New tobacco packaging law became introduced to the UK in May 2016 which concluded that blank packaging would be made for all tobacco products. New photographic images are also in place with new packaging which are incredibly disturbing to the public.
attributes.additional_details:
One packaging strikes myself which is incredibly appalling to be advertised is the packaging 'Smoking kills your unborn child' with a shocking image of a baby coffin with grieving parents looking over the cot. This image is absurd to anyone who may be going through miscarriage/loss child who DO NOT even smoke. 

Ban these shocking images, blank packaging is reasonable without going over the top.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for individuals or businesses to own more than 3 houses.
attributes.background: I can understand having second, even third homes but the property market is out of control and will continue to be so given the economic environment we live in. The damage here is to social mobility, community, growing inequality and to people who are low-medium skilled.
attributes.additional_details:
I see no appropriate or logical reason to own multiple (I.e more than 3). There is no justifiable reason that I can see. 

Business will get around this so there will need to be incredibly tight restrictions on commercial properties and a rigorous approach to those looking to bypass the law.

attributes.action: we need to follow the example of other countries and burn landfill for energy
attributes.background: Landfill is taking over a lot of land in the UK. We should follow by example and burn our rubbish for recycled energy
